metadata.title: CVE-2009-5155 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp inposix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause adenial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger anincorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-5155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu11.3').
gnulib: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
